intro: Sedella pentandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, blue, and white, bloom throughout the year in warm climates. Sedella pentandra is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
